name: Mass-energy equivalence
description: Energy equals mass times the speed of light squared (special relativity).

name: Kinetic energy
description: Kinetic energy of a particle of mass m and speed v.

name: Gravitational potential energy
description: Potential energy near Earth's surface (height h).

name: Maxwell–Faraday equation
description: A changing magnetic field induces an electric field.

name: Schrödinger equation (time-independent)
description: Eigenvalue equation for the energy of a quantum state.

name: Ideal gas law
description: Relation between pressure, volume, amount, and temperature of an ideal gas.

name: Planck–Einstein relation
description: Energy of a photon is proportional to its frequency.

name: Coulomb's law
description: Electrostatic force between two point charges.

name: Uncertainty principle
description: Position and momentum cannot both be known with arbitrary precision.
